00011    /*
00012    * Default constructor.
00013    *
00014    * Uses default seed only if this is the first instance
00015    */
00016    MTRand_int32::MTRand_int32() 
00017     : p(0),
00018       init(false)
00019    { 
00020       for (int i=0; i< n; ++i) state[i] = 0x0UL;
00021       if (!init) seed(5489UL); 
00022       init = true; 
00023    }
00024  
00025    /*
00026    * Constructor with 32 bit int as seed.
00027    */
00028    MTRand_int32::MTRand_int32(unsigned long s) 
00029     : p(0),
00030       init(false)
00031    { 
00032       for (int i=0; i< n; ++i) state[i] = 0x0UL;
00033       seed(s); 
00034       init = true; 
00035    }
00036  
00037    /*
00038    * Constructor with array of size 32 bit ints as seed
00039    */
00040    MTRand_int32::MTRand_int32(const unsigned long* array, int size) 
00041     : p(0),
00042       init(false)
00043    { 
00044       for (int i=0; i< n; ++i) state[i] = 0x0UL;
00045       seed(array, size); 
00046       init = true; 
00047    }

00049    /*
00050    * Copy constructor.
00051    */
00052    MTRand_int32::MTRand_int32(const MTRand_int32& other) 
00053     : p(other.p),
00054       init(other.init)
00055    { 
00056       for (int i=0; i< n; ++i) {
00057          state[i] = other.state[i];
00058       }
00059    }
00060  
00061    /*
00062    * Assignment constructor.
00063    */
00064    void MTRand_int32::operator = (const MTRand_int32& other) 
00065    { 
00066       p = other.p;
00067       init = other.init;
00068       for (int i=0; i< n; ++i) {
00069          state[i] = other.state[i];
00070       }
00071    }
00072 
00073    /* 
00074    * Generate new state vector.
00075    */
00076    void MTRand_int32::gen_state() 
00077    { 
00078      for (int i = 0; i < (n - m); ++i)
00079        state[i] = state[i + m] ^ twiddle(state[i], state[i + 1]);
00080      for (int i = n - m; i < (n - 1); ++i)
00081        state[i] = state[i + m - n] ^ twiddle(state[i], state[i + 1]);
00082      state[n - 1] = state[m - 1] ^ twiddle(state[n - 1], state[0]);
00083      p = 0; // reset position
00084    }
00085 
00086    /*
00087    * Init by 32 bit seed
00088    */
00089    void MTRand_int32::seed(unsigned long s) {  
00090      state[0] = s & 0xFFFFFFFFUL; // for > 32 bit machines
00091      for (int i = 1; i < n; ++i) {
00092        state[i] = 1812433253UL * (state[i - 1] ^ (state[i - 1] >> 30)) + i;
00093    // see Knuth TAOCP Vol2. 3rd Ed. P.106 for multiplier
00094    // in the previous versions, MSBs of the seed affect only MSBs of the array state
00095    // 2002/01/09 modified by Makoto Matsumoto
00096        state[i] &= 0xFFFFFFFFUL; // for > 32 bit machines
00097      }
00098      p = n; // force gen_state() to be called for next random number
00099    }
00100    
00101    void MTRand_int32::seed(const unsigned long* array, int size) { // init by array
00102      seed(19650218UL);
00103      int i = 1, j = 0;
00104      for (int k = ((n > size) ? n : size); k; --k) {
00105        state[i] = (state[i] ^ ((state[i - 1] ^ (state[i - 1] >> 30)) * 1664525UL))
00106          + array[j] + j; // non linear
00107        state[i] &= 0xFFFFFFFFUL; // for > 32 bit machines
00108        ++j; j %= size;
00109        if ((++i) == n) { state[0] = state[n - 1]; i = 1; }
00110      }
00111      for (int k = n - 1; k; --k) {
00112        state[i] = (state[i] ^ ((state[i - 1] ^ (state[i - 1] >> 30)) * 1566083941UL)) - i;
00113        state[i] &= 0xFFFFFFFFUL; // for > 32 bit machines
00114        if ((++i) == n) { state[0] = state[n - 1]; i = 1; }
00115      }
00116      state[0] = 0x80000000UL; // MSB is 1; assuring non-zero initial array
00117      p = n; // force gen_state() to be called for next random number
00118    }
00119 
00120 }
